result.execSummary:
This case is being appealed. If the court makes a decision in a case that a party disagrees with, the party may have the right to seek review by a higher court to determine if the trial court's decision was correct. Appeals are most often made after a trial or final decision in a case, but an appeal can also occur before a final decision.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Case called @ 1:31pm.  Defendant Jason L. Grant in court, in custody via video from Mendota Hospital with attorney jeramiah maynard.  Zeke S Wiedenfeld appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant would like to withdraw his petition.  Statement by DA Wiedenfeld, will stipulate to withdraw for 6 months, is concerned about repeat filingds.  Atty Maynard states reasons for petitioning the Court on the record.  Court makes findings based on reasoning to withdraw his petition before 6 months, at that point hearing would be held if filed.  State is in compliance with victims rights.  Atty Maynard to prepare order.  Minutes filed.

from Evidentiary Hearing on May 21, 2021

08:31 AM Case called. Attorney James B. Duquette in court for Defendant Jason L. Grant. Prosecuting Atty Zeke S Wiedenfeld appeared for State of Wisconsin. Defendant Jason L. Grant appeared by video means.
Discussion of whose burden it is. 
Discussion on witnesses. 
8:37am Dr. Brooke Lundbohm duly sworn in by the Court and testifies on direct exam of DA Wiedenfeld. 
Dr. Lundbohm identifies the defendant. 
DA Wiedenfeld asks the court to take judicial notice of Dr. Lundbohm's report. 
Court will mark Dr. Lundbohm's report as Exhibit 1 and will receive it. 
DA Wiedenfeld asks the letters dated 11/16/2020 and 5/12/2021. 
Court will mark as Exhibits 2 and 3 and will receive the letters. 
DA Wiedenfeld asks that Dr. Rawski's report be received. 
Court will mark Dr. Rawski's report as Exhibit 4 and it is received. 
9:04am Cross by Atty Duquette. 
9:16am Redirect by DA Wiedenfeld. 
9:41am Dr. Robert Rawski duly sworn in by the Court and testifies on direct exam of Atty Duquette. 
Court will take a recess and will reconvene at 11am. 
10:17am Court in recess. 
11:18am Court in session. 
Appearances remain the same. 
11:18am questioning of Dr. Rawski continues by Atty Duquette. 
11:32am Cross by DA Wiedenfeld. 
12:12pm Closing argument by DA Wiedenfeld. 
12:19pm Closing argument by Atty Duquette. 
12:27pm Court gives findings. 
Court finds Mr. Grant would pose a significant risk to himself or others if released. 
Court denies petition for conditional release. 
Atty Duquette to prepare order. 
State is in compliance with victim's rights. 
12:50pm Case adjourned.

June 21, 2016 - Dr. Robert Rawski's Report of Evaluation of Jason Grant, re:  criminal responsibility
Order for Placement

4:01 pm  Court in session.  Case called.  Appearances given.  
DA Zeke S Wiedenfeld appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant Jason L. Grant in court, in custody with attorney James B. Duquette.  
Court notes the victims, Jessica Kowalski is also present.  
Matter is before the Court for a final hearing on the NGI plea.  
Court makes record with regard to reports that the Court ordered after defendant was found guilty at trial and reasons the Court vacated those Orders.  
4:04 pm  Statement by victim Jessica L. Kowalski.  
4:09 pm  Argument by Atty Wiedenfeld in support of institutional care.  
4:18 pm  Argument by Atty Duquette.  Atty Duquette wants to first address the length of the commitment.  Defendant does not wish to give up the right to be reviewed / re-examined by a doctor.  
4:23 pm  Court proceeds with making its record.  Court quotes from different parts of Doctor's report.  Court notes that both Dr. Rawski and Ms. Martinez of DHS believe that a dispositional report / exam at this time would be premature since defendant is currently serving a prison sentence.  Court finds there is clear and convincing evidence that conditional release at this time would pose a significant risk of bodily harm to others as well as to himself.  Court will place him in institutional care.  Court next addresses issue of involuntary administration of medication.  Response by Atty Duquette.  Court believes Dr. Rawski's' opinion with regard to involuntary administration of medication still relevant today.  Court finds that there is clear and convincing evidence that there needs to be an Order for involuntary treatment and medication.  Court does not believe he is competent to refuse it.  Court next addresses defendant's request to reconsider the commitment period.  Court believes the 60 year term of the commitment is absolutely required here given the seriousness of the charges, the seriousness of his illness, the risk he poses to the public.  After he is released from prison, he would be able to petition for conditional release.  Atty Duquette asks if commitment is concurrent with or consecutive to the prison sentence he is now serving?  Atty Wiedenfeld asks that it be consecutive.  Court makes record and orders that the commitment be consecutive to his current prison sentence.  4:45 pm  Court in recess.

*TRANSCRIPT FILED 1-3-18: COURT REPORTER LINDA MATOSKA*

04/27/2017 Letter from Dr.  Rawski, re: Phase III dispositional eval
4/27/2017 - E-mail responses to Court from DA Wiedenfeld & Atty Duquette

4/26/2017 - E-mail from Kathleen Martinez of DHS, re:  PDI and SME reports ordered by Court
4/26/2017 - E-mail from Clerk to Attys forwarding e-mail from Kathleen Martinez of DHS

Random Listing Report

BAILIFFS:  George Clettenberg and Sharri Loveless.  
8:30 am  Court in session.  Case called.  Appearances given.  
DA Zeke S Wiedenfeld appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant Jason L. Grant in court with attorney James B. Duquette.  
8:33 am  Jurors seated in courtroom.  
8:33 am  Denise Jones, appears by phone, is sworn by Court and testifies on direct exam of Attorney Wiedenfeld.  
8:45 am  No cross exam by Atty Duquette.  
Exhibits marked, identified, offered and received:  #11;  

8:46 am  Jessica Kowalski is sworn and testifies on direct exam of Atty Wiedenfeld.  
9:47 am  Cross exam by Atty Duquette.  
9:58 am  Redirect by Atty Wiedenfeld.  
9:59 am  No recross.  Witness excused.  
10:00 am  Jurors excused from courtroom or morning recess.  Court in recess.  

10:17 am  Court in session with Attorneys and defendant.  
Atty Wiedenfeld makes record with regard to a statement by Ms. Kowalski during her testimony.  Atty Duquette makes record with regard to his strategic reasons for not objecting to witness' response.  Response by Court.  State has one last witness.  The defendant is not going to testify.  Court has colloquy with Mr. Grant as to his constitutional right to testify or not testify.  Response by Atty Duquette to Court's questions.  Court finds Mr. Grant's decision not to testify has been made freely, knowingly, intelligently and voluntarily.  

10:23 am  Jurors seated in courtroom.  
10:24 am  Officer Jacob Hintz is sworn and testifies on direct exam of Atty Wiedenfeld.  

10:27 am  Exhibit #9 (DVD) is played for the Jury.  

10:35 am  Continued direct exam of Officer Hintz by Atty Wiedenfeld.  

Exhibits marked, identified, offered, received and published:  #12;  
Exhibit 8 (crime scene photos) is published to the Jury;  
Exhibits marked and identified:  #13, #14;  
Exhibits offered and received:  #13, #14;  
Exhibits #13 and #14 are published to the Jury;  

11:03 am  Cross exam of Officer Hintze by Atty Duquette.  
11:05 am  Redirect by Atty Wiedenfeld.  
11:05 am  No further cross.  Witness excused.  
11:06 am  State rests upon receipt of all exhibits.  
11:06 am  Atty Duquette would like a moment to confer with his client to answer a question he has.  
11:07 am  Atty Duquette advises that Defense is not calling any witness.  Evidence is closed.  
11:08 am  Jurors excused for lunch break and asked to return at 1:00 pm.  

11:09 am  Court has jury instruction conference with the Attorneys.  
11:15 am  Court next addresses "lesser included" offense.  
11:16 am  Argument by Atty Duquette in support of lesser included offense on Ct #1.  
11:20 am  Response by Atty Wiedenfeld.  He does not agree that jury should be instructed on a "lesser included".  
11:24 am  Response by Atty Duquette.  
11:25 am  Response by Atty Wiedenfeld that is he is objecting to any argument made by the defense regarding defendant's mental health or that intent could not be formed because of a mental health issue.  He also believes an instruction with regard to intoxication should be given.  
11:26 am  Atty Duquette will not make those arguments in that regard.  Court makes record with regard to giving an Instruction on intoxication.  
11:28 am  Court in recess.  

11:42 am  Court in session with Attorneys and Defendant.  Court makes record with regard to defendant's request to instruct the Jury as to a lesser included offense.  Court finds no reasonable basis in the record for the instruction for a lesser instruction offense to be given.  Court denies the request for the jury to be instructed in that regard.  
11:51 am  With denial of the defense request for a lesser included, the defendant does not wish this to go to the Jury and would not oppose a directed verdict.  Court asks if he would be withdrawing his not guilty plea.  Response by Atty Duquette.  
11:52 am  Court takes recess to allow Atty Duquette time to speak with his client.  

12:09 pm  Court in session with Attys and Defendant.  
Mr.would like to change his plea to guilty and maintain his NGI plea as well.  
12:10 pm  Court has colloquy with Mr. Grant about his decision to change his plea.  Attorney Wiedenfeld that the State is stipulating to the NGI plea.  
12:11 pm  Attorney Duquette files Guilty Plea Questionnaire with the Court.  
12:11 pm  Court continues change of plea colloquy with Mr. Grant.  

Defendant enters "Guilty" pleas to Counts #1, #2 and #3 with the accompanying NGI plea.  
Deft acknowledges stipulating to the repeater status.  
Court gives warnings re:  1)  Deportation if not a citizen; may not vote until civil rights are restored; may not possess firearms; may not possess body armor.  
Response by Atty Duquette to Court's questions.  
Court finds defendant's pleas have been freely, knowingly, willing, and voluntarily choosing to waive his rights and enter these pleas.  Court finds there is a factual basis.  
12:19 pm  Attorneys make record with regard to the specific incidents to which defendant is pleading.  Court finds defendant guilty.  Court has reviewed the reports of the Doctors and makes further record that the defendant's special plea is supported by the reports.  Atty Wiedenfeld makes no argument regarding that issue and asks the Court make its decision based on the evidence at trial and the doctors' reports.  Response by Atty Duquette.  Court makes findings with regard to the NGI plea that it has been shown to the Court by a reasonable certainty by the greater weight of credible evidence that this is an appropriate plea and the Court will accept it.  Court will order the defendant committed.  Court calculates maximum total imprisonment could be 86 years (IC plus ES).  Court enters Judgment of NGI  on the counts with a commitment to the Department of Health  Attys agree on Count 1 that the maximum initial confinement with repeater enhancer would 46 years; Counts 2 and 3 would both be 7 years with repeater for a total of 60 days of IC; Court commits deft to the Dept of Health Services for a period of 60 years.  It will be consecutive to any other 971.17 commitment.  Atty Duquette does not believe it can be consecutive.  The Court will keep this commitment as consecutive but this issue can be revisited at the next hearing.  Court will grant defendant days of sentence credit and asks that Atty Duquette provide the Court will information to support the number of days of sentence credit.  

Court will adjourn the rest of the hearing.  Court Orders DHS prepare both a Predisposition investigation report with a supplementary mental examination.  Court will order that Dr. Rawski do the Supplementary mental examination if he is able to do so.  

Hearing on:  May 5, 2017 at 4:00 pm

12:43 pm  Atty Wiedenfeld makes record with regard to victims rights.  Court asks Ms. Kowalski if she wishes to make a statement at the May 5th court date.  She would like to be present in person rather than by video on that date to make her statement.  Court asks Atty Wiedenfeld to make sure the proper paperwork is prepared to make sure Ms. Kowalski is present.  12:48 pm  Court in recess.  
NOTE:  Jurors returned to Court after lunch as requested and were excused.

**TRANSCRIPT FILED 1-5-18: COURT REPORTER LINDA MATOSKA**
Voir Dire
Voir Dire List
Juror Selection and Peremptory Challenges
Seating for 14

BAILIFFS:  George Clettenberg and Sharri Loveless.  
8:40 am  Court in session.  Case called.  Appearances given.  
DA Zeke S Wiedenfeld appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant Jason L. Grant in court with attorney James B. Duquette.  
Matter is on this morning to address some issues before Jury is brought up.  
Discussion between Court and Attys concerning prior convictions of witnesses.  
Atty Duquette stipulates to the number of prior convictions of witnesses as determined by the State.  
Court has colloquy with both the defendant and the victim.  
Discussion as to whether parties have any stipulations.  
Discussion concerning expert witnesses who will be testifying.  
State has 3 recordings to play; 2 are audio and visual and 1 is just visual.  
Court received proposed jury instruction 601 submitted by the State.  Atty Duquette is in agreement with the proposed jury instruction.  
Atty Wiedenfeld makes record regarding the stipulation, re:  phase 2 of the JT;  Atty Wiedenfeld indicates he believes there will have to be a waiver of Jury Trial by the defendant on phase 2.  Court will take the waiver of the jury trial now.  Attorney Duquette does agree with that procedure but makes further record.  Court makes record with regard to the evaluations that were done and filed in this case.  Atty Wiedenfeld makes record as to the State's stipulation regarding the NGI.  Response by Mr. Grant to Court's questions, re:  stipulation to NGI phase of JT; Court is satisfied that both parties are knowingly making this determination not to have a jury trial as to the NGI phase.  Defendant stipulates to the repeater status.  Court has colloquy with Mr. Grant.  The victim does wish to be present during the entire trial.  Atty Duquette makes record with regard to lesser included instruction that he has submitted to the Court.  
9:05 am  Court in recess.

9:30 am  OFF THE RECORD AND IN JURY ASSEMBLY ROOM:  Clerk (feefee) takes roll call of jurors and administers Competency Oath to Jurors.  Jurors are brought upstairs by bailiffs and seated in the back of the Courtroom.  Clerk seats 24 jurors in the Jury Box.  

9:52 am  Court in session.  Case called.  Court reads allegations of the Information.  
9:55 am  Attys introduce themselves as well as other Attorneys in their office.  
9:55 am  Atty Wiedenfeld introduces potential witnesses.  
9:57 am  Atty Duquette introduces himself, his client and the other Attorneys in his office.  
9:57 am  Atty Duquette does not have any additional witnesses other than potentially his client.  
9:58 am  Court explains process of voir dire.  
10:00 am  Voir dire by Court.  

10:16 am  Voir dire by Atty Wiedenfeld.  
10:30 am  Voir dire by Atty Duquette.  
10:47 am  Attorneys take peremptory challenges.  Court explains process to Jurors.  
10:56 am  Clerk reads names of Jurors who have been excused.  
10:57 am  Attorneys approach Bench to speak with Attorneys.  
10:58 am  Atty Duquette has no objection to the Jury.  
10:59 am  Clerk gives Oath to Jury.  
10:59 am  Jurors who were not selected are excused.  
10:59 am  Court takes 10 minute break for the Jurors.  
11:01 am  Court makes record with regard to sidebar with the Attorneys.  Atty Wiedenfeld makes record with regard to a Juror strike taken by the State.  11:03 am  Atty Duquette indicates he is withdrawing his objection based upon State's reasons for striking the juror.  11:03 am  Court in recess.

4:04 pm  Cross exam by Atty Duquette.  
4:05 pm  Witness excused.  
4:05 pm  Court takes brief recess before State calls next witness.  

4:07 pm  Discussion concerning next witness which is the victim.  Court asks parties if they wish to conclude for the day now or continue with a witness at 5:00 pm  Attys request that we finish for today and then pick up with testimony tomorrow.  Court will ask bailiffs to let jury know they are released for now and are being asked to return tomorrow at 8:30 am.  Atty Duqette asks that jurors be brought back in so that they can be instructed not to discuss the case.  
4:11 pm  Jurors seated in courtroom.  Court explains to jurors that they are being released for the day and that this trial will likely conclude tomorrow.  Court instructs jurors that they cannot discuss this case with anyone until the case has already been concluded and a verdict has been reached.  
4:13 pm  Jurors excused and asked to return at 8:30 am.  
4:14 pm  Court takes a short recess and will come back after the break to discuss jury instructions.  
4:27 pm  Court in session with Defendant and Attorneys to review jury instructions.  Court goes through the State's proposed list of Jury Instructions.  Discussion concerning instructions relating to "lesser included" charges.  Atty Wiedenfeld has 2 other Instructions he may want given.  He does want Instruction 255 to be given.  Atty Duquette has no objection.  The other Instruction which Atty Wiedenfeld may be requesting is Instruction 517.  
4:39 pm  Court asks Attorneys to be present at 8:30 am tomorrow.  Court in recess.

**TRANSCRIPT FILED 01-04-18: COURT REPORTER LINDA MATOSKA**
E-mail from DA Wiedenfeld forwarding revised version of JI 601
4/13/2017 - E-mails between Attys and Court
State

2:30 pm FINAL PRE-TRIAL CALENDAR:  
DA Zeke S Wiedenfeld appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant Jason L. Grant in court, in custody with attorney James B. Duquette.  
Matter is on today for a final pre-trial.  This case is the #1 case for jury trial next week.  
Both Attorneys confirm that the defendant is stipulating to the NGI plea.  Atty Duquette makes record that he is confident this will proceed to trial on Monday.  DA Wiedenfeld makes record that he believes the statutes require that the Jury be instructed that there are 2 phases to the trial - pursuant to Sec. 971.165.  Continued discussion between Court and Attorneys.  Attorneys advise that they will be speaking tomorrow about a number of other issues and believe they may be able to work this issue out.  Court asks that Attys notify the Clerk's court of any agreement on this issue before 4:30 pm tomorrow.  Court notes that no motions in limine have been filed by either side.  Both sides are asking for sequestration of witnesses.  Court will so order.  The State's court officer and the victim may be present in the courtroom for the trial.  Court makes record with regard seating arrangements for the victim when she is present.  No objection by the Attys to the Court's proposal.  Discussion concerning prior convictions of witnesses, if any.  Court will have 2 alternates so there will be 24 jurors seated in the box initially for voir dire.  Court is anticipated some requested lesser included instructions.  Court asks Attys to provide it with the Jury Instruction # for the instruction they may be requesting.  Attorney Wiedefeld makes a record with regard to offers that have been made to the State.  Atty Duquette did convey those offers to Mr. Grant.  Court has colloquy with Mr. Grant.  He is aware of both of the State's offers.  He confirms that he is rejecting both offers made by the State.  Court notes there were statements made here but there were no Miranda-Goodchild motions filed.  Defense has choosen not to challenge the admission of any of his client's statements.  Atty Wiedenfeld makes record he he was a Court Commissioner at the time this offense was committed.  He set the original bond on this matter and signed search warrants on this matter.   Atty Duquette was aware of this and has discussed it with his client.  The defense has no objection to proceeding with DA Wiedenfeld or anyone from his office.  Attys to be present in Court at 8:30 am Monday morning.  Court will have the Jury ready to come upstairs at 9:30 am  2:53 pm  Court in recess.
